meanings.definition: The quality or state of being uncool or unfashionable.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit had a strong naffness about it.
meanings.sent2: The neon fanny pack screamed naffness.
meanings.sent3: The naffness of his dance moves made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The naffness of the retro furniture clashed with the modern decor.
meanings.sent5: The naffness of the old car was impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: Something that is tacky or tasteless.
meanings.sent1: The souvenir shop was full of naffness.
meanings.sent2: The plastic flamingos added a touch of naffness to the garden.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly gifted him a statue of a gnome, embracing the naffness.
meanings.sent4: The naffness of the cheap jewelry was evident from afar.
meanings.sent5: The party decorations reached new levels of naffness.
